snippet: The Commerce Department said gains in overseas investment income and exports narrowed the imbalance to $81.1 billion.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that the United States' trade deficit fell to $81.1 billion in the fourth quarter, lowest level in 14 years; cites big gains in exports and overseas investment income.
lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department said gains in overseas investment income and exports narrowed the imbalance to $81.1 billion.

headline.main: U.S. Quarterly Trade Deficit Was the Smallest in 14 Years
headline.print_headline: U.S. Quarterly Trade Deficit Was the Smallest in 14 Years
